criteria: Understanding and acknowledgement of diversity dimensions (disability, gender, race, sexual orientation, body size).
Respectful and inclusive language and attitude towards diverse groups.
Application of diversity awareness to real-world scenarios.
descriptions: Demonstrates no understanding of diversity dimensions.
Identifies one diversity dimension but lacks understanding.
Identifies at least two diversity dimensions with superficial understanding.
Identifies multiple diversity dimensions with moderate understanding and provides basic examples.
Clearly identifies and explains various diversity dimensions with specific examples and shows nuanced understanding.
Demonstrates comprehensive understanding of diversity dimensions, provides insightful examples, and analyzes the complexities within each dimension.
Demonstrates unintentional biases through language or attitude.
Uses mostly respectful language but occasionally slips into stereotypes.
Consistently uses respectful language and shows a generally inclusive attitude.
Actively promotes inclusive language and challenges stereotypes; demonstrates a respectful attitude.
Exemplifies inclusive language and attitude, actively advocates for respect, and challenges discriminatory behavior.
Unable to apply diversity awareness to any real-world scenarios.
Attempts to apply diversity awareness to a scenario but misses key aspects.
Applies diversity awareness to simple scenarios with limited understanding of complexities.
Applies diversity awareness to a variety of scenarios, demonstrating an understanding of relevant issues.
Critically analyzes complex scenarios and applies diversity awareness to create inclusive solutions.
Develops innovative and effective solutions for promoting diversity and inclusion in complex real-world scenarios; addresses systemic issues.
